intro: Phyllanthus baillonianus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry forests. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
